results.title: Who Will Have the Last Word on the Universe?
results.abstract: Modern science suggests that we and all our achievements and memories are destined to vanish like a dream. Is that sad or good?

media.caption: The hot star Wolf-Rayet 124, captured by the James Webb Space Telescope during a brief period in its life cycle before becoming a supernova. Our sun won’t become a supernova, but it will begin to die in about 5 billion years.
media.copyright: NASA, ESA, CSA, STScI, Webb ERO Production Team
